content.raw: I don't think so. This message is used to modify physics parameters, and with optional fields you can update a subset of the parameters with a given message.

content.raw: `magnetic_field` is [required](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=physics#physics_magnetic_field) on SDF. Should it be required here too?
content.html: magnetic_field is required on SDF. Should it be required here too?

content.raw: @scpeters , I saw you removed the topic from altimeter and magnetometer, but it is a top level sensor [property](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=sensor#sensor_topic). Wouldn't it be better to properly place it on `ServerFixture` instead of removing it?
content.html: @scpeters , I saw you removed the topic from altimeter and magnetometer, but it is a top level sensor property. Wouldn't it be better to properly place it on ServerFixture instead of removing it?

content.raw:
mm I am getting compile errors:

~~~
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc: In member function ‘virtual void gazebo::sensors::AltimeterSensor::Load(const string&)’:
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc:109:62: error: ‘ignition::math::Pose3d’ has no member named ‘Ign’
     this->dataPtr->altMsg.set_vertical_reference((this->pose.Ign() +
                                                              ^
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc: In member function ‘virtual bool gazebo::sensors::AltimeterSensor::UpdateImpl(bool)’:
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc:139:49: error: ‘ignition::math::Pose3d’ has no member named ‘Ign’
     ignition::math::Pose3d altPose = this->pose.Ign() + parentPose;
                                                 ^
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc:142:63: error: ‘ignition::math::Pose3d’ has no member named ‘pos’
       this->dataPtr->parentLink->GetWorldLinearVel(this->pose.pos).Ign();
                                                               ^
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/MagnetometerSensor.cc: In member function ‘virtual bool gazebo::sensors::MagnetometerSensor::UpdateImpl(bool)’:
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/MagnetometerSensor.cc:140:18: error: ‘ignition::math::Pose3d’ has no member named ‘Ign’
       this->pose.Ign() + this->dataPtr->parentLink->GetWorldPose().Ign();
                  ^
make[2]: *** [gazebo/sensors/CMakeFiles/gazebo_sensors.dir/AltimeterSensor.cc.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
~~~

looks like we could just remove the Ign() call since they are alreayd ign math types

mm I am getting compile errors:

/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc: In member function ‘virtual void gazebo::sensors::AltimeterSensor::Load(const string&)’:
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc:109:62: error: ‘ignition::math::Pose3d’ has no member named ‘Ign’
     this->dataPtr->altMsg.set_vertical_reference((this->pose.Ign() +
                                                              ^
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc: In member function ‘virtual bool gazebo::sensors::AltimeterSensor::UpdateImpl(bool)’:
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc:139:49: error: ‘ignition::math::Pose3d’ has no member named ‘Ign’
     ignition::math::Pose3d altPose = this->pose.Ign() + parentPose;
                                                 ^
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/AltimeterSensor.cc:142:63: error: ‘ignition::math::Pose3d’ has no member named ‘pos’
       this->dataPtr->parentLink->GetWorldLinearVel(this->pose.pos).Ign();
                                                               ^
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo2/gazebo/sensors/MagnetometerSensor.cc: In member function ‘virtual bool gazebo::sensors::MagnetometerSensor::UpdateImpl(bool)’:

The sensor works for me, really cool :smiley:

I added the magnetic field to the model list widget and set a magnetic field to the example world in  c8315ad, feel free to merge if you think it's alright.

content.raw:
I was trying to add an example world in a separate [branch](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/add_sensor_magnetometer_louise?dest=add_sensor_magnetometer_nate#diff) just to see if this works but it turned out to be more complicated than I expected. Am I writing the SDF wrong? 

There's probably a problem related to the error everytime gazebo is launched:

~~~
[Err] [PhysicsEngine.cc:264] Caught bad any_cast in PhysicsEngine::SetParam: boost::bad_any_cast: failed conversion using boost::any_cast
[Wrn] [PresetManager.cc:80] Couldn't set parameter [gravity] in physics engine
[Err] [PhysicsEngine.cc:264] Caught bad any_cast in PhysicsEngine::SetParam: boost::bad_any_cast: failed conversion using boost::any_cast
[Wrn] [PresetManager.cc:80] Couldn't set parameter [magnetic_field] in physics engine
~~~
content.html:
I was trying to add an example world in a separate branch just to see if this works but it turned out to be more complicated than I expected. Am I writing the SDF wrong?

There's probably a problem related to the error everytime gazebo is launched:

[Err] [PhysicsEngine.cc:264] Caught bad any_cast in PhysicsEngine::SetParam: boost::bad_any_cast: failed conversion using boost::any_cast
[Wrn] [PresetManager.cc:80] Couldn't set parameter [gravity] in physics engine
[Err] [PhysicsEngine.cc:264] Caught bad any_cast in PhysicsEngine::SetParam: boost::bad_any_cast: failed conversion using boost::any_cast
[Wrn] [PresetManager.cc:80] Couldn't set parameter [magnetic_field] in physics engine
